t: 1 Corinthians 16
Now*p concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, even so do ye.
Upon*p the first day of the week let every one of you lay by him in store, as God hath prospered him, that there be no gatherings when I come.
And*p when I come, whomsoever ye shall approve by your letters, them will I send to bring your liberality unto Jerusalem.
And*p if it be meet that I go also, they shall go with me.
Now*p I will come unto you, when I shall pass through Macedonia: for I do pass through Macedonia.
And*p it may be that I will abide, yea, and winter with you, that ye may bring me on my journey whithersoever I go.
For*p I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarry a while with you, if the Lord permit.
But*p I will tarry at Ephesus until Pentecost.
For*p a great door and effectual is opened unto me, and there are many adversaries.
Now*p if Timothy come, see that he may be with you without fear: for he worketh the work of the Lord, as I also do.
Let*p no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.
As*p touching our brother Apollos, I greatly desired him to come unto you with the brethren: but his will was not at all to come at this time; but he will come when he shall have convenient time.
Watch*p ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.
Let*p all your things be done with charity.
I*p beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and that they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints,)
That*p ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth with us, and laboureth.
I*p am glad of the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus: for that which was lacking on your part they have supplied.
For*p they have refreshed my spirit and yours: therefore acknowledge ye them that are such.
The*p churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.
All*p the brethren greet you. Greet ye one another with an holy kiss.
The*p salutation of me Paul with mine own hand.
If*p any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha.
The*p grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
My*p love be with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen.
